address: Xã Long Điền B, Huyện Chợ Mới, Tỉnh An Giang
thought:
**Analysis and Mapping of "Xã Long Điền B" to its New Administrative Unit**

Okay, so I've got "Xã Long Điền B, Huyện Chợ Mới, Tỉnh An Giang" as the old address.  I immediately focus on the "Xã Long Điền B" part, noting the province is An Giang. I'll ignore the District for this purpose - it's for context.  My first step is to confirm the province hasn't merged. A quick check of Resolution 60-NQ/TW shows that An Giang remained An Giang, so no issues there.

Now, I dive into the actual ward resolutions, primarily 1654/NQ-UBTVQH15, the one related to An Giang. I scan through it, looking for any mention of "Long Điền B." Bingo! Line 35 explicitly states the merging of "thị trấn Mỹ Luông, xã Long Điền A và **xã Long Điền B**" into the new ward, **"xã Long Điền"**. That's a direct match, and I can confidently assign the old ward to the new one. No other relevant resolutions are needed.

I move onto confirming "xã Long Điền" exists in the "New Wards" data.  I quickly find it with the code "30631" and confirming province name as "Tỉnh An Giang".

This is straightforward.  My citation will be clear, directly pointing to line 35 of the 1654/NQ-UBTVQH15, highlighting the merging of old "Xã Long Điền B" into the new "Xã Long Điền". The confidence level is certainly "high" given the direct mapping and lack of ambiguity. So my JSON will include the relevant details from the data I pulled - the citation, confidence, the new ward's code, name, and province.  That's it, case closed.

citation.header: 1654/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh An Giang
citation.line: 35. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Mỹ Luông, xã Long Điền A và xã Long Điền B thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Long Điền.
